### üìù Login Details

**1Ô∏è‚É£ Login With The Following:**
- **Login:** `exam`
- **Password:** `exam`

**2Ô∏è‚É£ In iTerm:**
- Type `examshell` in the terminal

**3Ô∏è‚É£ Your 42 Intra Account:**
- **Login:** your 42 intra username (e.g., `prossi`)
- **Password:** your password

**4Ô∏è‚É£ Your 42 Intra Photo:**
- Allow photo check

**5Ô∏è‚É£ Access Rendu:**
- Type `y` or `yes`

**6Ô∏è‚É£ In the Exam Shell, You Have Only The Following 3 Commands:**
  - `status` - check the time and other things
  
  - `grademe` - submit the exercise to be corrected by moulinet
  
  - `finish` - close examshell and finish exam

**7Ô∏è‚É£ Open a New iTerm or VSCode:**
  - You can find your exam subject in the directory `subject`
  
  - In the directory `Rendu`, it is your repository
  
  - Create a folder named after the project and start working in that folder

---

### üì§ Submission Details

When you are ready to submit your function/program, go into `Rendu` and push the folder you created by doing the following:

1Ô∏è‚É£ `git add <folder name/files in folder>`

2Ô∏è‚É£ `git status`

3Ô∏è‚É£ `git commit -m "any commit message you like in these strings"`

4Ô∏è‚É£ `git push`

5Ô∏è‚É£ After you `git push`, type `grademe` in the examshell for your project to be evaluated.






> [!NOTE]
> You can use both VSCode and Vim during the exam. üë©üèª‚Äçüíª
>
> Always ensure you check the name of the folder and file. ‚úÖ
>
> Check also [useful git commands](https://github.com/DevAwizard/Exams_42/blob/85f054a01928540ae34785cc7974b81453a164bb/.github/Resources/Useful_git_commands.md)
